Name: Tenants Notified, Painting
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notifying tenants of a landlord's obligation to paint and the procedure to schedule a painting.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

    	Section 1.  Subparagraph 2 of subdivision b of section 27-2013 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
    	(2) Repaint or re-cover the walls and ceilings with wallpaper or other acceptable wall covering every three years, and more often when required by contract or other provisions of law.  An owner shall notify a tenant in writing of the owner's obligation to repaint or re-cover the walls and ceilings at least one month prior to the expiration of the three-year period.  Such notice shall also inform the tenant of the procedure to schedule the repainting or re-covering of the walls and ceilings.  The department may prescribe the form of such notice and shall make such other rules as are necessary to implement this section.
    	ï¿½2.  This local law shall take effect immediately.
    	
   	Referred to the Committee on Housing and Building.
